Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: wmmuga
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. It was very easy to get to every where and the restaurant across the street was AMAZING! the hotel staff was also very helpful! I would suggest it!

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: russiangirl298484
Reviews.Content: An old hotel but a real gem. The rooms are small but spacious and very clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and obliging, you get the feeling that nothing would be too much trouble. Breakfast is included in the roof garden and very tasty. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: tracy b
Reviews.Content: this stay was wonderful, the staff was very considerate, very helpful. We particularly enjoyed the location of the hotel (right in the city centre, so easy of access) and the Roof Garden restaurant for breakfast with the spectacular 360° view, even more impressive in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “good enough for a weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dankiedebal
Reviews.Content: stayed for a long weekend and we were handed the heavy brass key that i had read so much about however i have to be honest it was ok for what we wanted which was basically somewhere close to the main sights where we could lay our head and freshen up! the staff were great, very helpful and friendly, we had arranged transfers from and to the airport and this was done very easily and on time. The room - whilst the decor is probably not to everyones taste was clean and presentable, the bathroom was small but hey how much time do you actually spend in your bathroom! The shower was hot and the towels were clean. we did have a strange smell in the bathroom but i put the plugs in and shut the door and being as we were only there to sleep and shower it was ok. the breakfast room on floor 3 has beautiful views and is a marvellous way to begin your day. Breakfast was self serve and consisted of various breads, toaster, scrambled egg,boiled eggs, bacon, tea coffee, juice, yoghurts, meats , cheese, pastries, cereals everything you would expect really. Now to the main plus point- the location !! you can easily (within ten minutes )walk to many locations including colosseum, trevi fountain, many ruins, cafes, pantheon, etc etc. we had a lovely amble to the vatican through side streets and past many beautiful buildings churches and piazzas. great stay great weekend in a truly great city.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL FOR FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: VITALIIII
Reviews.Content: this is a small hotel in the center of Rome and is very good for family.wery quite location close to the most important place of the city.the room is ok but the brerakfast on the top floor is really great. we will come again

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice”
Reviews.Author: marylampard
Reviews.Content: The best thing of thIs hotel Is the location, very central, close to trevi fountain, colosseum and spanish steps. The room was small, but that Is the european size, so it's normal. Anyway the hotel was comfortable and cleaned. Very nice breakfast. I think it Is a nice choice if you want visit rome walking.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 404Anonymous
Reviews.Content: This is a shocking hotel and the hotel staff are the worst we have ever met!Our room was not fit for any human and was stinking of milton, with dirty walls and floors. Pure and simple disgusting!!! You had to go sideways through to the bathroom and you hadn't room to swing a cat. Hotel personnel were the rudest and most unhelpful that can be met and CANNOT deal with problems and disregard their clientele. AVOID at all costs!It will ruin your experience of Rome FOREVER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anton K
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome was amazing, everything was new and interesting. Our opinion about the hotel can be subjective but let us to say few words. The location of Bolivar is perfect, the breakfast was good especially with the awesome overlooking on the terrace. The room was small but for us it was not so bad, we stayed there only in the nights because we were spending our time walking, making pics, eating great Italian food, enjoying the town. The personal of the hotel was nice. By the way Angelo was the one of the positive impressions of our trip, friendly, very helpful in answering questions, we appreciated his advises about Rome. The warm reception that we got would certainly make us stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to stay very near to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Agent_Ka
Reviews.Content: Many times Tripadvisor was a competent advisor for me, but I’m so lazy traveler to write here…ou! Now in frosty Moscow days I remember my warm trip to Italy in deep autumn days 2011. Travelling with friend, we spend only 2 days in capital city, but after all we know the next objective for our holidays – Roma! And his exciting places, «diving» to history, friendly and communicative natives. As a place to stay we chosen hotel Bolivar that situated on the walking distance to main interesting sites of downtown. Maybe one inconvenient detail – hotel stands in the hill, but at least does not make trouble for active travelers. We were accommodate in double room – not a big, but cozy enough and optimally styled. As we observed on our Italian trip, size of rooms are mostly optimal for overnight only, not to live, but we prefer walk and visit places, don’t stay over the roof )) We really thanks to friendly personal of Bolivar, receptionist Angelo was really our «travel angel» for short stay in Rome – we’ve got many useful advices about good restaurants in the near, transport access, and good bookstore because we need to find Italian fairytales book for my collection. We did not use wi fi on the hotel, so, can’t say about connection, but booked number with breakfast and were quite satisfied, even prefer more various breakfast (or maybe we are very picky after heavy breakfasts in Austria, where we’ve been before Italy). Actually, now we want return for more detailed «research» of Rome and we’ll choose same Bolivar, as known for us and pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Päivi M
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights in Hotel Bolivar, Rome and I - we all - can highly recommend this hotel!! We booked the rooms directly on the internet and got a nice reduction as early bookings - the offer was very good - and I recommend to have a look on the offers -site. As we needed two rooms for 3 adults and 1 child /teenager, we got the rooms close to each other on the first floor. This was really great and helpful for us. The rooms are really nice: renovated, confortable and clean. We had nicely space in the room. The staff is very kind and helpfull around the day, it does not depend who is on duty. We used the lobby bar and it was a nice surprise that the prices are low. Normally you have quite high prices on the lobby bar - but not in this hotel. The hotel has a great location - close to all the important places like Fontana di Trevi, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Not to mention all the shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. I will book this hotel when visiting Rome next time - and I have visited other hotels in Rome as well. Päivi

Reviews.Title: “Traditional facility and service in this Central City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeoLev5
Reviews.Content: Hidden in a back-street, like all gems should be, some of the surrounding atmosphere may be odorous but that's how it is in traditional authentic locations. Management full of enthusiasm and assistance, all the sights and sounds nearby or pleasant walks, no bother getting transport when needed. And a spectacular breakfast on the roof-terrace.

Reviews.Title: “I'm really conflicted about this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kellisima
Reviews.Content: In reading other recent reviews, I'm glad to hear that there are two sections to this hotel. We were definitely assigned to the "old, run down" section of the hotel (we had the huge brass key rather than the key card that was mentioned in another review so if you receive a key at your check-in do NOT leave the check-in until you get one of the "newer" rooms). On the one hand, the location could NOT be better! That was definitely 5 stars in our book. The lobby/entrance is beautiful. The service was great. The rooftop breakfast room is WONDERFUL!! Its elegant, with plenty of windows for you to soak in the rooftop view, and there was a really nice variety of hot and cold breakfast food that was well tended to by the staff. The bedroom on the other hand was HORRIBLE. Completely not sound proof in the least, we were constantly awakened by anyone and everyone that climbed the stairs, took the elevator, or entered/exited their rooms on our side of the floor. The bathtub/shower situation is a joke. The furniture is visibly decaying - seriously we were thinking that if they could just varnish the chair, change the drapes, and sand and paint a little it would be at least a little better. BUT since there are apparently nicer rooms in the hotel, we would stay here again if we could stay in one of those rooms. Our room extremely disappointing. ...is it because we used our Choice Privileges points to "pay" for the room that we ended up with one of their lower end (aka crappy) room?? BOTTOM LINE: excellent location. we'd stay here again but ONLY if we could get a newer, nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not such a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: owamibuy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and nothing special. The pictures on the hotel's main web page make it look like a beautiful, old-European-style hotel. Not so much in person. No free wi-fi. They make you pay for it in the lobby--only a half hour at a time. Rooms were falling apart. It's older and set back into an alley. Really hard to find, your first time. Take a taxi to it from the Main Termini or airport. Don't try to walk from Termini. :-) The location, however is GREAT! Walkable to everything in central Rome. Only minutes walk from the Colosseum, the Forum, etc. So if you don't mind a bit of dumpy hotel & okay breakfast, it's a good find. I recommend buying Choice Hotels points on their website and using those for this hotel. Then it's a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Deeply disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KMO0106
Reviews.Content: I think my room was in the old section which certainly wasn't depicted in the hotel's publicity pics. The newer rooms I noticed had card keys while mine was a traditional one. The wall safe couldn't be accessed and the exhaust fan/lights didn't work in the bath room. The men at reception were unhelpful, rude-one even threw my key down when I handed it to him. Weird. The woman in the breakfast room cared more about acquiring tips than actually working. The cleaning staff was nice, though. I had stayed in their sister hotel Nova Domus near the Vatican which was infinitely nicer. Since I used Choice Privileges Hotel points, I'm glad I stayed longer at the Nova Domus than the Bolivar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: 8SandyVDH
Reviews.Content: The location, service and ambiance was great. The location puts you right in the center of Roma, within walking distance of the main tourist destinations and amazing restaurants. We walked every where except the Vatican because of time. The staff was very helpful and the room was good. The room was small for 4 of us but, everything was clean, well kept and worked. I loved the efficiency! Sandy V

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: samuel a
Reviews.Content: wery good stay, perfect location for visit the city. Peter and the staff ( Vincent in particolar ) were great. They helped us for all. We will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: VazzaSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Rome. Near good restaurants, transport and shops. Staff helpful and friendly. Parking very convenient out front.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location BUT room quality varies A LOT!”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location, walking distance to all the key attractions and very helpful staff BUT make sure you don't get a room on Level One or make sure you pay less for it. After complaining about the quality of my room I was moved, and it was lovely, like a completely different hotel. Only downside is the coffee served at breakfast - this is possibly the only place in Rome without an espresso machine??!! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorset000
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, 10 mins walk from Trevi and all the other great places to visit in Rome. Our room was amazing, a 4 poster bed in gold!!!! Peter the manager was a star, told us where to go, what to see, arranged our taxis and recommended an amazing restaurant. This is a must for anyone who wants to enjoy Rome at its BEST. Be back soon...................................

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Rome, great location, GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: MattandRhonda
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Bolivar over the Internet from Australia. We had no idea about the location. We were so happy to find the hotel so close to everything. The staff were fantastic, always going out of their way to help us. We could not have been more happy with our choice of hotel, we recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Could've been better”
Reviews.Author: vladtsapko
Reviews.Content: It is very difficult to say something unpleasant about Bolivar Hotel. Location – as everybody says here – is perfect. You can get to all the most important attractions within 5-15 minutes by walk. There are a lot of good restaurant in the area and of course the shopping is marvelous. We really liked service. At first we booked the room with the balcony and it was ready upon our arrival. But an administrator offered the other room which we liked more. As we saw two rooms I may say that they are quite small and these are only to come to sleep and continue exploring Rome the next day. The breakfast is good. It is usual continental breakfast. But there was one big minus for us. Their Wi-Fi Internet has a very complicated system to log in. At first you have to type in the special code which they give to you at the reception and only after that you are able to surf the Web. I don’t know why but I had big problems with my PC and I managed to log in only once in the beginning of my trip. Thanks God Iphone did not have any problems with it but anyway we had to wait for the connection for approx. 5-7 minutes. Anyway we have good impressions from the hotel but we do not think that it deserves its 4 stars. It seems to us that they have strong 3 stars. Anyway the price was affordable and we have more pleasant memories than negative ones. If you are looking for the small hotel in a quiet location this may suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe this is a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: mc582
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this hotel boasts 4 stars on its website. In reality it is a bad 3-star.  For a similar rate you can easily get much better solutions, so please do not stop searching! I remember Hotel Artemide being an excellent 4-star in the same area. CONS - My room was small and run down. It would need a radical renovation to compete for 4-star - Blinds, tapestry and carpets were dirty, on top of being old and run down - No amenities. Even the basics were missing: the TV was so small that it was impossible to watch it in bed - Poor breakfast - WiFi available for free, but working very poorly PROS - Location, in a cozy square a few steps away from a number of Rome landmarks

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting... think twice about booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PiKinni
Reviews.Content: I rarely have nothing good to say about a hotel... there's always a new experience. Reviews from burned customers always make me roll my eyes. I'm not normally so bothered but having been treated in such a way. I would like to share my experience so you don't make my mistake. This is rated as 4 Star. In all my travels around the world my only comparison is to think cheap motel meets Renaissance brothel and you get the picture. Upon arriving to my room I was almost sick with the smell of what could only be described as getting on a bus on a hot day with 30 hobos that hadn't washed in a month. The experience was only enhanced by a nonfunctioning A/C unit. Three of the staff including the manager all came to mess around with the knobs and dials and to tell me that (despite being on full power) there was some air coming out of the vent. An interesting observation given that I couldn't feel a thing. No appropriate compensation was offered and during the course of the discussion it was strongly implied that I am a liar. I was even told that the payment was taken by the .com agency. I checked with them, not so. I rest my case for the honesty stakes. This 4 star hotel would suit you if you are looking for a motel style stay but want to part with all your spare cash. For a considerable fee you can expect to experience plastic cups wrapped in plastic, "Exclusive" toiletries such as wafer thin bars of soap wrapped in large amounts of plastic, a small sachet of shampoo and shower cap. If you like the bed linen you will also find this for your hand towel. The toilet paper will be found propped up against the wall on the bidet as there is no holder, although the bathroom is so small you'll not have to hunt far for it. I'm glad I didn't want too much privacy as the bathroom door was broken (in my "newly refurbished room" according to management). If you'd like a thicker pillow you'll need to fold the one you get in two but at least there was only one sheet on the bed otherwise I may have passed out in the night given the non-functional A/C. Pleasantly it is in a quiet spot. Useful when you need to open the windows to let the smell and the heat out. Rome is a beautiful place. Just don't spoil the experience by being fooled by the pictures provided on the internet. The staff are only friendly when there isn't a problem. Otherwise they will pester you at 1:30am and dismiss your problems as lies and promptly turn to some other irrelevant issue... just like the time I bought some..........

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterza
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic stay, we had a great room on the second floor - fantastic views from the window and the bathroom window looked onto an open courtyard. The hotel staff could not have been more accomodating and helpful with arranging transfers from the airport and a taxi to the train station on our departure. Perfect location, away from the noise but close to all the historical attractions - even in walking distance to the Vatican (just make sure you pack your comfortable walking shoes). Breakfast was great, more than enough options including bacon and eggs! Highly recommend Hotel Bolivar to anyone travelling to Rome

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: fredsmithjr
Reviews.Content: Some of the front desk staff were great and some were very poor. Stayed on both ends of trip to Italy. First stay was not as good as the second. FIrst room had worn carpet and beding and a broken shower door. Room located on 2nd floor over hotel entrance and was VERY noisy...between the hotel standing outside smoking and talking and street noise. Excellent location and very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: LOVETRAVELALWAYS2
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel Bolivar was excellent. The rooms were lovely withnample closet space, nice bathrooms and charming french doors that opened for an abundance of fresh air. most importantly the hotel provide an excellent nights sleeps. Breakfast was more than we expected and we found the location to be both convenient and slightly of the beaten path. i hope to return again there

Reviews.Title: “Great location; take care which room you get!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertAlison
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and the location of this hotel could not have been better; 10 minute walk to all the major sites once you have got your bearings. The hotel is tucked away down a side street away from the noise of the city which is great. Our room was on the first floor and to be honest I was disappointed with it. The pictures on the website show the rooms to be far better than the one we stayed in. All the rooms on the second floor and above have been renovated and appear to be much nicer ... more luxurious. Our room was a flashback to the seventies, complete with stains on the carpet and 'very tired ' furniture. As to whetther there is a difference in prices for the rooms I can't be sure, but I'm not convinced there is. The breakfast room in on the roof terrace and this is lovely. You get a good choice as well and there is plenty of it. All in all, this is a good hotel but only if you get the right room.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done”
Reviews.Author: NonLoSo2011
Reviews.Content: For a short stay solo traveler this is a good deal. Clean. Perfect location for seeing the sites. Very tiny room. Shower stall about the size of a casket, so you cannot bend over and wash your lower body. You have to step out of the shower to do that. But, I was looking for someplace, clean, located within a few blocks of major sites, safe, not gloomy, and for a short stay, inexpensive. This passed the test with ease. Perfect for the business traveler, or couple on a budget. Concerning the size of the room and shower, that may just be the room I had; a basic single. Probably doesn't represent all rooms. For the price I paid, this was a ridiculously good deal. Very clean, and not run down at all. Because it is tucked away and hidden, I heard no street noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Bolivar was very helpful in making my stay more enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: gregofstjohn
Reviews.Content: When the person behind the desk recommended a restaurant that would have a wonderful family atmosphere, I was quite impressed that they were interested in making my stay comfortable and enjoyable. Then, he, personally, walked us over to that restaurant to make sure they were open and available. That kind of personal attention I received the whole time I was there. They were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel at the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Camazotz
Reviews.Content: By all means try and find this hidden gem. Approach it from the Via Nazionale side, otherwise you;ve got some steep steps to climb. Despite being in the centre, it's in a quiet road only a few minutes from the Mercati Traianei. With such a central location, it's easy to get to most tourist spots. Staff are friendly and very helpful, both face to face and via e-mail. Breakfast room on the third floor also allows you to eat a hearty start to the day and watch the sun come up over the city. Thoroughly recommended, also, try the restaurant just opposite, quiet, but very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferFierro
Reviews.Content: -Friendly staff -Great service -Clean rooms -Perfect location, only minutes away from the Trevi fountain (Walking distance)

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tallrover1
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 nights so we could see the sights without the children (had been to Rome before on a day trip with my family whilst staying further north). When we arrived our room wasn't ready due to someone being ill and refusing to leave. We were offered 2 choices, stay at their sister hotel or come back in a couple of hours. We decided to move to the Tea Hotel because of the need for a shower and change. This hotel is very tired and the breakfast poor. In its favour it opened up all the great shops near the Spanish steps and Via Veneto. The next day we moved back and Bolivar moved all our stuff whilst we were out sightseeing. The hotel was much better, breakfast was excellent though someone on another review mentioned the poor quality coffee and it hasn't changed! The room was fine though the floor looked like it needed a clean but overall pleased with the entire experience. Location is world class and the city is brilliant. Apart from sleeping in either hotel we spent less than 2 hours in the places anyway, there is too much to see and you don't want to be stuck in a hotel room do you?

Reviews.Title: “There are plenty of hotels in Rome... pick one of those!”
Reviews.Author: Electricious
Reviews.Content: Booking the hotel online was easy enough. The Hotel Bolivar is situated in the center of Rome, walking distance from the Colosseum, as well as numerous other cultural and historical sites. The hotel's location is it's main selling point! The Bolivar claims to be a 4 star hotel. This might have been true in the 1960's. It hasn't been renovated since then. Though the concierge was extremely welcoming, the hotel was not. Our rooms were relatively spacious, but poorly maintained. The windows leaked, making it extremely cold at night. This wouldn't have been a problem had the hotel had a heating system (which according to the front desk, it does not have any heating/ cooling system). Other than the cold, it was difficult to sleep at night because of the terribly uncomfortable bed... and the noise. The walls are very thin, and every night when people would come back from partying at 2-3am, we would hear everything. Trying to give the hotel a fair chance, I looked at things such as cleanliness to make me feel better about staying there. Big mistake! The toilet paper was kept on the handle of the toilet brush (which looked like an original piece from the hotel's establishment decades ago). The sheets were not changed during the 3 days we spent at the hotel. There was hair in the bathtub, as opposed to soap and/ or shampoo, which was unavailable. A 'household incident' left hair cream on the mirror, which wasn't cleaned on during the entire duration of our stay... and to top it all off, breakfast was very poor - no fruits or veggies anywhere in sight, save for some canned peaches in a dish. When my friend and I checked out, I did feel bad for the person at the front desk. In all her frustration, my friend verbally attacked the man over the poor state of the hotel and it's service... or lack thereof. I guess we should consider ourselves lucky he was at the front desk, as most times the staff members were outside the front entrance smoking and we would have to wait 10-15mins for someone to appear at the front desk, lobby 'cafe,' etc. During our time in Rome, we passed plenty of gorgeous hotels. Next visit we'll be staying at one of those!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and a wonderful location with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: arthurloev
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and great location with transportation nearby. Good breakfast included. though on a small side street-,can hear traffic noises during night with window opened. DEFINITELY WOULD RECOMMEND nice room and clean establishment NOTE SO MANY MANY TOUR GROUPS IN THE CITY THAT WAITS ARE VERY LONG AT MOST PLACES. we were there about 10 years ago and loved the city-- now we were disappointed due to the many many tour groups which caused long waits and took away from the flavor of the city. EXAMPLE 3 1/2 HR WAIT AT VATICAN. CHAPEL, ETC IF NOT WITH A TOUR GROUP

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: topochka
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star hotel. In fact it is not even three star hotel. Everything is old Rooms are clean but staff is very helpful but the whole apperance is depressing. Hotel is in a middle of all attractions but it is a 25 min. walk from Termini. So if you are traveling by train you will need a taxi to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “According to your preferences”
Reviews.Author: RobertWolfgang
Reviews.Content: When you look for a really quiet place in the centre of Rome located at footwalk distance to many monuments you find this at an acceptable price in the Bolivar. If you look for minimum cost you will find lots of other hotels (e.g. in the Termini area). Or you go for some luxury even in Rome, then you might find it in Five Star Hotels (as I know from business trips). But even if the four stars of the Bolivar are debatable, it is a recommendable place with competent and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, helpful staff,”
Reviews.Author: quanah
Reviews.Content: booked a single room was given a double room as i was staying 5 nights. Staff had good english no communication problems and were very helpful. Room very comfortable for one but would have been a squash for two people. Room serviced every day. Hotel very well located for city centre yet away from heavy traffic. One issue with the bathroom the shower was broken and had to hold by hand to use.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dnolan9
Reviews.Content: Slightly off the beaten path, this quiet hotel is near shopping, restaurants, cafes, monuments. The breakfast on the roof garden area served every breakfast food anyone could want, fresh air, sunshine and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NuriaMonfort
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, well located, just in centre. All the monuments are very near 5 or 10 minutes walking. Friendly staff, Peter was very helpfull. Confortable room and beutiful breakfast room on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID at ALL COSTS!!!”
Reviews.Author: domdel
Reviews.Content: Because of a flight issue, we thought we would be able to switch our vacation around last minute to spend some time in Rome. So, 4 days before arrival, I reserved 4 nights at the Bolivar, despite it's poor ratings (#456 out of 1,000 hotels, I know, but I was desperate, travelling solo with 3 children and the good hotels were booked solid). When we found out that our flights could not be changed, we cancelled our reservation two days later. Because we cancelled within 2 days of arrival, the hotel charged me TWO FULL NIGHTS, over $700. That's right, they charged $700 NOT to stay there. Clearly, they are motivated by your cash, not your comfort or customer service. That is evident in all their lousy reviews, to which I wish I had paid more attention. I suppose we got lucky, we could have had to pay $700 AND stay there as well. If the hotel decides to the the honest and right thing and refund at least PART of my deposit, I will post here on Tripadvisor that they still have some decency. Otherwise, take it from me and all the other readers who rated this hotel "Poor" and "Terrible" and beg any of the other 455 hotels rated higher to let you stay there- or anywhere -other than the Bolivar.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but far from a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxthetraveller
Reviews.Content: More like a good 3 star. Location is excellent but the hotel itself is somewhat dated and a bit over priced for what you get. Small bathroom with motel type amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not really a four stars”
Reviews.Author: stuart70LasVegas
Reviews.Content: Location it's great!!!!! but the Hotel is not really a four stars we had a small room on the first floor and it was very dated but fine staff was ok and friendly as written in many reviews Breakfast in the morning was poor but good quality Plannig our stay we booked on internet transfers and tours so we used Inlimorome for a full day tour and pickup/dropoff from the airport and Civitavecchia port. We had a tour of the city in a nice Mercedes with A/C worked wonders for us The next time I am in Rome, I would not hesitate to use it again. Andrea the drivers we had on both our trips was so helpful! We always were very comfortable. I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “This was a very quaint hotel, great service, clean and location superb”
Reviews.Author: Maria294265
Reviews.Content: Thank you for our stay at the Hotel Bolivar. This was our first trip to Rome and the hotel was in a great location to see all the magnificent sites in Rome. The staff were very helpful and courteous and I would recommend my friends to use this hotel if travelling to Rome. The room and facilities were adequate for our needs. It was a very quaint hotel and it was also easy to communicate as the staff's command of English was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good breakfast with an excellent view !”
Reviews.Author: Wezelakkers
Reviews.Content: We could easily visit all famous buildings by foot: Piazza Venezia with the statue, Coloseo, St Peters Basilica with the sistence chapel, Piazza Navona, The Spanish Stairs, The Pantheon, St Angelo, Campo dei Fiori, Le Fontane Trevi, ... ---------------------- The Staff was also a great help when we couldn't fluy back due to the Vulcano. So if you have a problem just ask them. ps excuses for mistakes : i'm not an English speaking person.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and tidy hotel with a gorgeous, central location”
Reviews.Author: Henk1990
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a side street, close to the Via Nationale. Location was marbelous; Colloseum, Forum Romanum and the Capitolian musea we're on walking distance. Staff was friendly, rooms we're small but adequate. All in all our stay was very nice and Rome was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Potential to be good”
Reviews.Author: figbet
Reviews.Content: This is a second review of this hotel as I had to edit the first as promised to the hotel manager, Peter based on them changing my room. Booked this hotel on leisure before going to Tivoli on business. Checked in on Friday night and very nice personnel. English was ok, but tried to be accomodating. When I was escorted to my room (114,) I was shocked at how small it was. I guess our business travel agent had booked a single. But it did not look like the pictures on the website. I have done a lot of travel in Europe, so small doesn't surprise me, but this was SMALL. The bathroom door doesn't open all the way, you have to straddle the bidet to sit on the toilet and can barely squeeze through the corner shower doors. The closet was so small the hangers barely fit and if your suitcase is left in the room you cannot walk. The room was very dated, with old carpeting and old headboard and old fabric walls. But the bathroom was clean. The worst part of all was in the morning when I woke up with a sewer smell coming from the bathroom. I could not open the window to air out. Needless to say, I had nothing to compare to so thought this was the norm. However, my work collegue came to meet the next day and we didn't see her room until that night (223.) What a difference. You could walk in the room. The shower seemed huge in comparison, didn't have to straddle anything on the toilet and the floors were tiled. Most of all....No smell. When asked to change upon return to the hotel in the evening and the smell getting much worse, the front desk said they could not change due to being fully booked. Also, they stated that our rooms were different rates, yet we were charged the same although I had booked for one addtional night. They stated that even though we booked the same room rate, they had to upgrade her at no charge because the single room was not available. I did find out that they had closed rooms that day due to the sewer problem. This may have been the reason for the upgrade. After much pleading, they did come up and put deordizer down the bathroom drain after three attempts (which probably explains why I didn't smell it when I walked in) and opened the window. They did change my room to the double deluxe (222) that was similar to my colleagues the next day and I was charged the same rate. However, I had to get through a night of intense sewer smell which made me quite ill. When I went down the next morning, the manager, Peter, asked why I would have posted a review on TripAdvisor that was negative instead of talking to him. It was the hotel's opinion since I did not tell them of the smell they could not change me at 9:30 at night when I returned because of being fully booked. As stated, they had closed other rooms in the hotel due to the sewer problem so I am not sure why they didn't move me at that point on their own. It would have been very obvious to the cleaning staff that there was a problem. The front desk staff couldn't stand to be in the bathroom when trying to open the window. They both were gagging. I had tried to wait in the morning to talk, but there was a long line to check out and I had to catch a tour bus. I did not return until the evening and as stated did not know there was an option until I saw my colleagues room. When I tried to take the issue up with Choice Privileges, the hotel admitted the sewer problem as well. They did not offer a discount for the inconvenience. I asked for extra points. They said they would work on it, but have not provided any type of compensation for the problems incurred, nor have even provided the points for the stay I had and paid for. Something about booking through a travel agent. My colleague had to return to the hotel later in the week. They gave her the canopy bed from the hotel pictures and she said it was beautiful. (221?) The management will take care of patrons, that is definite. Unfortunately, they did not take care of me and treated me quite poorly in the process blaming me for the issue as I didn't say anything. As for other hotel ammenities: The breakfast is average. The location is wonderful. If looking to book this hotel, be sure to book a double deluxe room or higher. They are quite nice. If they can only guarantee the single, I would suggest finding a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlandJane
Reviews.Content: I read the Trip Advisor comments about this hotel thoroughly before we left which was great because there were no horrible surprise when we arrived. In fact it was actually better than expected. We had arranged with the hotel for transport from the airport at 50 euro for the 4 of us and all our luggage so there was a man waiting with a sign with our name on it - we were pleased we'd paid the small amount extra for this service as we'd travelled from Australia and were knackered. Check in was smooth, staff were friendly, our room was on the 2nd floor with a double and two twin camp bed style beds - neither of the kids complained so they must have been comfy. Our bed was hard but we slept ok. Not much room to move and the bed covers were old and dirty but the linen was clean and the bathroom refurbished and pretty good but small. Breakfast was fine, perfectly edible, the breakfast room is brilliant and a good start to the day. The best thing about the hotel is the location - lots of great sights a short walk away and for things further afield bus stops close too. I thought we paid a bit too much however it was Easter and so I guess everything would have been dear and we had limited time so the location was key. So long as you know what to expect I would say this hotel is fine for people needing a great location and a base only, don't book if you want to sit and watch TV or spend a lot of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Walking, Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntentionalTraveler
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful 5 minute walk to the Coliseum Metro and almost next door to Hadrian's Market! The hotel is small, friendly, clean, and relatively inexpensive. If you are a positive fun loving traveler this hotel will be excellent for you. If you are picky and cross, stay home. Our room was small but nicely done with tile floor and tiled bath area. The breakfast was good and the breakfast area, on a top floor, is a good place to start and plan the day. If I ran the place, I'd be sure the curtains were fully open each morning so travelers would get the sun and a bit of a view. The staff opened them on request but why not as a standard practice? I would stay here again but might stay at another place only to be in another part of the city, for variety, as I have been in Rome several times. For first time travelers, the Bolivar is fine!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: nadusriri
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 unforgettable days in a very nice room wih a great terrasse on the roof. The hotel is very well situated, you can walk everywhere wihout using transport. The staff is very attentif and friendly. Good choice for holidays and business

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked us but it all worked out”
Reviews.Author: mere811
Reviews.Content: Well, I didn't think it would happen to us after reading another review about this hotel overbooking, but sure enough, it did. When we arrived to check in, they informed us they didn't have a room for us. It seems as though they are renovating a few rooms at a time thus the overbooking problem that guests face. The staff informed us that we had to be placed at a sister hotel (a 3 star hotel and farther from tourist attractions), The Hotel Principessa. We put up quite a fuss and they provided us free drinks and scheduled a ride for us to the other hotel. The ride didn't show promptly so one of the workers took us to the Hotel Principessa on his way home from work. They made sure our luggage was brought back the next day, upgraded our room and gave us several hours of free WiFi. It was unfortunate, but it worked out okay in the end. Really, the staff was so kind, friendly and helpful that it made a negative situation seem not that bad. Aside from this, the room was fine, comfortable and clean. The breakfast here was good and better than other standards breakfasts we had on our Italy trip. At least the coffee is fresh and not instant! The location is the reason we booked this hotel and believe it or not, I would stay here again even with the overbooking issue for this very reason. It's a PRIME location. 10 min to Trevi, 10 to Ancient Rome, 15 to the Pantheon. 20 min walk to Termini station. Just cross your fingers that if you book a room, its yours to have upon arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, Atitude and good service from the desk”
Reviews.Author: AviBchar
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel gave us good time by its personal services, thakns to Mr. Peter in the desk!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does overbooking and puts guests in lower-class hotels located in remote areas”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller8006
Reviews.Content: When booking a room at Hotel Bolivar, I found that it offered the perfect balance between location and price. However, I never got to stay at Hotel Bolivar. At checking, we were told that some rooms did not have electricity and that we had to stay in another hotel (Hotel Principessa) located 2 kilometers away. The hotel staff assured us however that we had been upgraded to a better room. I wonder if that is even possible considering that Hotel Principessa is a three-star hotel (vs. 4 stars for Hotel Principessa). Hotel Principessa looked pretty bad and, worst of all, was away from all major touristic sites. We had to take a lot of public transportation (buses and metro) to go anywhere (even to Termini station). I think Hotel Bolivar is used to such practices and that we were not an exception. As we were checking out Hotel Principessa, other tourists were being brought from Hotel Bolivar. In my opinion, such behaviors are totally unacceptable and close to fraud. I will never recommend Hotel Bolivar to anybody. My own experience was like buying a business class ticket on a major airline and ultimately flying in economy class on a cheap airline...without of course any refund!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but needs some work...”
Reviews.Author: cjk8489
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Bolivar for three nights during our vacation in Rome. We got a triple and a double, and while the rooms were decently sized (especially for a budget hotel in Europe), the bathrooms were in desperate need of updating. As my sister stated, our shower in our triple looked like a "test tube" and you literally had no room to move around in it. The beds were hard as rocks but we ran into that at a lot of our hotels in Italy...must be a European thing. The man working the desk at night was very rude and unhelpful. My grandmother had fallen and we politely asked for some bandaids, but he told us the hotel did not have a first aid kit. What kind of hotel doesn't have a first aid kit?! My parents had to walk at 11 o'clock at night to find an open pharmacy. The next morning the nice man working at the desk informed us they did in fact have a first aid kit behind the desk! What a jerk...and to top it all off, they were installing new TVs so we didn't have tvs in our room for the first two nights and when they were installed we barely got any channels. The internet isn't free, and when we asked for it at night the person at the front desk made us wait 30 min while he wrote down things into the computer (when it would've taken him 30 seconds to print out our internet password) One thing the hotel has going for it is its location. It is located very close to the Spanish Steps (~20 min walk), the Trevi Fountain (~10 min walk), and the Roman Forum is just down the hill. There is a good restaurant just across from the hotel that we ate at the first night. A little pricey, but very convenient if you're looking for a close place to eat after getting in from the airport. The car service they offer is very reasonable from FCO airport...50 euros for 4 people with luggage, I would recommend this hotel for the location, but if you're looking for luxurious bathrooms with a nice staff during the evening hours, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: shalom_at_all
Reviews.Content: Great location- a short walk to the trevi fountain, pantheon, spanish steps, and piazza navona. The room 221 and hotel are impeccably clean. Nice stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TonyNewry
Reviews.Content: Terrific location convenient to most of the major tourist attractions. The hotel facilities are excellent and the hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. I would have no hesitation in staying there in future.

Reviews.Title: “a nightmare come true”
Reviews.Author: bambou13
Reviews.Content: we went to the bolivar last year and were apalled by the dirt ,the lack of ......everything that made a hotel worth that name. breakfast disgustingly cold , old and poor.........the location is good but feeling stuck in that dirty filthy hole was a real sacrifice..........walls paper-thin with screams and fights between the workers!!! everything to make this stay unbelievable. a real nightmare .cheap for a hotel but far too expensive for what it was!!!! i will pay to be taken out of there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful Staff,”
Reviews.Author: SmileyGirl44
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, 5 mins walk to Trevi, 5 mins to tomb of the solider, 10 mins to main shopping area. Ideal! Although they did put us on the first floor, which is terrible, clean but real old. when complained they said they could move us the next morning and it didn't seem a problem they even moved our luggage when we were out sightseeing. Breakfast wasn't great, cereal and toast, and some eggs. but all in all, accomodation in Rome is expensive and I think this is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever been. A truly unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: clau_arad
Reviews.Content: Dark room.Tthe only window of the room had blocked sunblinds so we couldn't see the sunlight. We felt like kept in a prison. Small bathroom with very old accesories. I was hearing everything from my neighbours because we had a common door inside the room (closed). The breakfast was by far the most "economical" i ever had with very bad quality cheese and salami. Yuk! The only good thing I can remember was that the towels and bed clothing was clean. Otherwise the cleanlines was less than mediocre. They claim that hotel is situated in a very quiet location. I agreed until the last day when a nice guy from the neighbour building turned the music very loud at 4 a clock in the morning. No way to sleep anymore. I'll never stay in that hotel again. It's a pitty that it has so nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Small,clean,safe,centrally located extremely helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: traveladvisor09_9
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get airline mileage credit so used Choice Hotels-good medium priced hotel chain. Location was the main reason then cost. Wanted to maximize our time in the city-so choose the added expense of a car at the FCO airport. Thru emails with Peter, who repled to every inquiry I had, he arranged it. I wanted a car I could pay be credit card. No problem. AC in Rome was very important. The hotel chain verifed the hotel the hotel had AC and there were no issues at the hotel before we left the states. Peter even came to the room to make sure it was correct in the settings!! The hotel has a roof top breakfast room serving cold cuts, cheese,cereal, juice, coffee and all on starched white linen with a chandelier in the middle of the room!!! No paper plates or plastic here!!! Also has Elevator- small but works!! All the tours comapnies we had-picked us up at the hotel. Drop offs were within 3 blocks each time if not right at the hotel driveway. Hotel room was on 1st floor with a wide open winding stairway-were roomy-they offered to split the big bed into to twin beds several times-we declined-it worked out fine. Roomy bathroom had the standard europen toilet and a bidet and small narrow tub only drawback-no shower curtain-water got everywhere. Hairdryer that worked-bring your converter. There was occasional noise with people going in and out of rooms in the hallway at night but not enough to complain. I have worked in the travel industry for over 30years-I would use this hotel again for a budget vacation trip with emphasis on being out and about during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveler93
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 3 people so need more beds than most. They tried to give us room 311 that feels like it is an attic. They showed us room 312 and it didnt have a shower curtain and said they would give us towels to wipe up the water. We did finally get room 218 that was acceptable. The breakfast was just ok. We stayed at 4 hotels in Italy this trip (3 Comfort Inns like this one) and we thought it was the worst of the hotels and breakfasts. The location was very convenient and as long as you dont go in with high expectations you will be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPride
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a quiet street just off a main shopping area. located steps from many bus stations that will take you anywhere in Rome (the 40 or 64 will take you across town to the Vatican). You can walk to the Trevi Fountain or the Coliseum. The room was quiet and we slept very well. The included breakfast was a great way to start the day. The staff was friendly – especially Peter. The TV system did not work while we stayed and the Internet was down. I highly recommend this hotel. However, it is not 4 star based on American standards (I would rate it as a 3 star hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Paid room for FOUR but got room for Two”
Reviews.Author: Aroundtheworldus
Reviews.Content: We reserved a quad room in Hotel Bolivar for over $300.00. I payed for a room with two queen size beds but they said there was a leak in the roof and we got a tiny room with only 2 twin size beds. this hotel was HORRIBLE. stay away from it and its related hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: laurent322
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. You can not dream a better location. You wake up and start discovering the amazing sites of Rome, AROUND THE CORNER. The people working there are hospitable, friendly. Also, QUIET! It' doesn't feel like you are 500 meters away from the crowd of the Trevi Fountain. Hotel is hidden in a nice courtyard. In front of it, two authentic italian restaurants, they aren't tourist trap but nice family owned. Breakfast room is overlooking the roofs of Rome. The room is totally correct and clean with airconditioner. And price was really really good. 100% Satisfaction Laurent from Brussels :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: rocketguy2
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation with the Hotel Bolivar, but upon arriving, the manager told us that our rooms were not available due to a sudden water problem (we were shown a ceiling in the entrance that had water damage, but it appeared old, and there was furniture beneath it!) We were offered a room at a nearby recently renovated hotel, which the manager marked for us on a map. However, when the complimentary van dropped us off, the hotel was not at the location indicated (it was much further away from the main tourist sites, etc.). The second hotel quoted a rate that (amazingly!) was the same as our first rate. The hotel was somewhat run down - only some of the guest rooms had been renovated. We knew we probably getting taken but it was already getting late, so we took the rooms rather than trying to find alternate arrangements. Upon returning home, we learned that the second hotel charged us twice their normal rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ellisshu
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our choice of the Bolivar Hotel in Rome, mainly because of its great location. We were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain in one direction, and to the Colosseum in the other direction. The room was comfortable and bigger than what we had expected. The hotel is located just off a main street but in a quiet courtyard, and we slept well. The staff was courteous and helpful, and spoke English. Breakfasts on the third floor were fine. No faults at all with this hotel, yet if I was forced to say something negative, because no place is perfect, it's the fact that when returning to the hotel by foot after a long day of sightseeing, you have to climb a small hill from Palazzo Venezia and/or a steep set of stairs on Via Della Cordonata. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely return to the hotel next trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dudee
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find a moderately priced hotel in Rome but this place is it. The hotel sits at the end of a small, short alley. As we were in Rome during a time when A/C is not used the road and outside noise that can keep you awake is nil. The English speaking desk staff is competent, quick and helpful with tour tickets, car to the airport (50 euros) and restaurants. It is about 8-10 minutes walk fro mthe Trevi Fountain and the Piazza Venezia. Seafood Restaurant in walking distance: Corte del Grillo osteria. Fish was fresh and the English speaking staff customized our meal to what we want and how much. Reasonable, too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, helpful staff, wonderful breakfast-in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Marcia50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Hotel Bolivar. The location was fantastic, you can walk to most of the sights in Rome: the Colseium, Trevi Fountain and we even walked back from Easter Mass at St. Peter's Square. The staff were very helpful in answering questions, providing a clean room and serving a wonderful breakfast. We used hotel points for our stay. Our room was basic, clean and everything was in working order. I read the previous review and while I can understand disappointment when the room does not look like what is pictured, it's been my experience that expectations regarding star ratings for rooms in Europe can differ greatly from room ratings in the US. I.E., a five star in Europe probably will not be considered a 5 star in the US. I typically spend a few days in a city and want to explore. I love being able to walk out my door and go to sights quickly and easily and not have the hassle of additional transportation to and from. In this senario, in European cities, where you are very near the attractions (and in a safe area), I find that I typically give up room size and some ammenities and that often times with the star rating, that location is taken into account. Our stay at the Hotel Bolivar allowed us to experience all of Rome, right out our front door. I would go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: pzmtij
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend on our last trip in Rome and i have to say that we were very satisfied from the stay. The hotel is in a very good position, in the center of Rome near the Termini station and near to all the important turistic sites. The room was very comfortable and very clean. The personal is kind and available to provide any information u need. I highly recommend it !!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: toomanykaties
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location. The Colesseum and Forum are less than 5 minutes away in one direction and the Trevi Fountain is less than 5 mins in the other which made the hotel very good for site seeing. The room was clean and basic. It wasn't large but it was functional for a short break. The bathroom was fairly small and basic with toilet, sink and bath (shower head was on the taps of the bath). The service was average and helpful. The breakfast was a standard continental (cereal, fruit, toast, bread, cold meats, yoghurts, scrambled eggs and pastries) which was more than enough to set you up for a days walking round a beautiful city. For a short city break the hotel is fine. If you are looking for a hotel for a honeymoon or special break, I would perhaps think about looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: annoyed80
Reviews.Content: I cant begin to explain how crap this hotel was. The pretty pictures on their web site is a total lie. We paid good money for a 4 star room for our honeymoon. What we got was nothing that even resembled any of the pictures on their site. We were shoved in a dark room with a window that overlooked at dirty grafiti ally way. The decor of the room was dated back to the 70's with floral wall paper and carpet walls. Nothing worked properly in the room, the taps didnt work, the light were missing trimmings with wires hanging out, we were given to pillows about as thick as the one rag of a blanket they gave us and we had to request more. The staff at the front desk were complete jerks to us as well. The only half decent thing about the hotel was the view from the breakfast room, if you could get past the scowling italian maid serving us. pfft. If your considering this hotel dont bother, you will be ripped off like we were.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a GREAT stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: hancockj44
Reviews.Content: The Bolivar Hotel is in the very heart of Rome, close to the most important monuments and attractions of the city and to one of the most important shopping street, Via Nazionale. The hotel's position is ideal to reach soon the Coliseum and the Fori Imperiali and to explore Rome’s eternal beauties. Our stay in this hotel has been pleasant and very comfy. It's definitely the ideal solution for a family vacation. Good breakfast, very nice staff, and our room was new and clean. We will surely come back here for our next holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Bolivar”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on hotel points, so it was a good deal. First the location was great! You can walk to any site from this location, very central! We arrived on New Years Eve, so the hotel was fully booked. We were put into an old room as described in some earlier reviews...I was not too happy and asked to be moved. The guy at the front desk was nice, but he said there's nothing open that night, but he'd move us the next day. That was fine, it was NYE afterall and I didn't expect anything to be open anyway. He offered to show us the room he'd move us into the next day, so we went and took a look. To my surprise, the room was occupied with the guest's personal belongings in the room when he invited us in to take a look. I mean, the front desk guy was in there with us the whole time so it's not like we could have taken anything...but it's still wierd. The room we got the next day was much nicer, very updated. I loved the painted cieling and the decor. The room was tiny, but I was expecting that. The best part was the breakfast! The room where they served breakfast had a very nice view. The breakfast was better than the other Italian hotels we stayed in. There were hot foods and fresh pastries. I like that I could make real toast instead of just the packaged fake toast(although that's available, too). Overall this was a nice stay. It was a great deal since we used hotel points and it was NYE so that's even better. I wouldn't have paid what they were asking for for the nights we were there, but would maybe pay their low-season rate and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Craig1970
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, staff helpful & friendly and appearance of hotel from outside & reception area was nice. Room clean, decor was basic but in keeping with the area. Room also has a safe in the cupboard which is free to use. Toilet small but adequate. Hairdryer mounted on toiler wall but not very good as it was really old fashioned and kept cutting out (much to the annoyance of the wife) so would recommend you take your own dryer. Breakfast was good with all the usual continental offerings plus scrambled & boiled eggs. Hotel is centrally located for all the main tourist attractions. Approx 10 mins walk from the Termini station, 10mins too the Trevi fountain & Spanish steps, 15mins to the colosseum & 25mins to St Peters & Vatican. All walks take you buy loads of great sites so worth walking. Ensure you agree Taxi prices before you get in as they will try to rip you off (22 euro fron Termini station to hotel which is only 2.5 km away). Hotel has free tourist maps at reception which make finding your way around Rome easy. Good hotel in a good location, would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: waynepanna
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. The rooms are small but very comfortable. The bathroom is large with plenty of hot water. We were there in Jan so air condition was not a factor and there was more than enough heat. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. After talking to us in English they knew what we wanted and suggested some tours. The Vatican city was one of them and they took care of all tickets and reservations. The breakfast that is included was abundant with fresh breads and meats, cereals and pastry. Milk, juice, coffee and teas. The entrance is first rate, but you do enter from a tiny road of about 50 feet. It looks like a dead end and then you turn the corner and there it is. I will post pictures later. Most of the roads in Rome and Florence are tiny and look like they go nowhere, but at the end you either get another alley type way or a huge open piazza. You will save a bundle because this Hotel is within walking distance of all old Rome. Only the vatican City is a taxi ride away. Check Google Earth to get a birds eye view of the area. Hotel Bolivar has it all. It is not a resort, it is a hotel. We stayed there for 3 nights and then went to Florence and came back to Hotel Bolivar. This time they gave us a new renovated room. Room 106. Fantastic with a brand new mural ceiling painting and 3 beds. (Two pushed together) Both rooms are a steal in Rome. Internet access is a 7 euro charge for one hour. However, there are internet cafes that charge 1 euro for 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: cas50Cambridge
Reviews.Content: my friend and i were a bit worried about some of the reviews for this hotel but nothing was too much trouble for the staff especially as during our stay there the airport was closed unexpectedly. Its location was fantastic for sight-seeing and the accomandation very comfortable. The warm reception that we got would certainly make us stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bolivar - a little hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: BrightDee
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel only the day before arrival and could not have been more pleasantly surprised at how smooth our check-in was. We received an email advising that they would arrange for pick up from the airport (for a fee) but we had already arranged for our own transport. There a quite a few steps leading up to the hotel, however, it can also be reached by road and you can be driven right up to the entrance. On arrival at the hotel (travelling with other family members who had booked separately), we were greeted with the friendliest manager on the reception desk - he had both our bookings and receipts ready and was most apologetic that our rooms were not ready (even though we were early and not expecting them to be!). He recommended that we head out for some lunch which is what we did - the restaurant he recommended was friendly, the food was amazing and the prices were more than reasonable! When we returned to the hotel, we were shown to our rooms which were beautiful - all with lovely ornate wrought iron detailing and shutters. The bed was superbly comfortable, the bathroom was pristine and the decor overall was tasteful. We had breakfast both mornings (which was included in the price) in the garden terrace room - the breakfast was basic but delicious with croissants, pastries, scrambled eggs, toast, yoghurt, cereals, fresh fruit etc. A great start to the days of sightseeing ahead! This hotel is superbly located with all main attractions within walking distance and with loads of fantastic restaurants, cafes and bars in the vacinity. Overall, this hotel gets the thumbs up from everyone in our group. All the staff are warm, welcoming, friendly and really want you to enjoy your stay. The hotel is well maintained and in a fantastic location. We could not believe the quality for the price!! I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellagio30514
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Bolivar in Rome for three nights. The service was very good- very friendly front desk. The breakfast was average- it had some variety. The room was small but very clean- this was one of it's strong points. The location was good. It was very close to the Trevi fountain and the Roman empire attractions (Roman forum, Colosseum, Imperial Forums). The hotel is a little far from the Vatican (as most hotels are) and it was a little walk to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona where we hung out two of our nights in Rome. Piazza Navona was our favorite piazza but the restaurants in there are on the expensive side. Although Rome is flooded with tourists, the Hotel Bolivar is in a quiet spot in Rome (down a side street), which we felt was another one of the hotel's strong points. Two of our three nights we used our Choice hotel points (therefore we only paid for one night). The one night we paid for was expensive, therefore I may hesitate staying at this hotel again if we were able to find another hotel of the same quality at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel in a great part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CarmineNJ
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I checked in for 3 nights in order to do a little sightseeing of the city of Rome. We chose it based on other feedback we read on Expedia and Tripadvisor and were glad we did. The hotel is located about 100 yards down a type of side street off of the main road, so it is somewhat hidden. The hotel itself is cozy and has only about 25 rooms. The room we stayed was very small, but nicely appointed and had frescoed ceilings and was very clean and in good condition. The bathroom was of a proper size and had a nice shower stall. We thought the location of the hotel was great for sightseeing as it is located withing walking distance of many of the famous sites. There are several places to eat, get a cocktail, or a gelato nearby. The staff at the hotel spoke good english and were very pleasant. When we decided to take a day trip to Florence, they had a cab waiting for us to take us to Termini train station within 5 minutes. The Bolivar is no more than an 8 minute cab ride to Termini station. The complimentary continental breakfast was good, offering various types of breads, cereals, cheeses, italian cold cuts, coffee, hard boiled eggs and juices. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would consider staying at the Bolivar again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: GuessWho2008
Reviews.Content: We paid for a quad room and basically got a twin room with two extra beds shoved in the room. The staff were arrogant and rude and did nothing to help when we complained of issues with the room. the bathroom was tiny and the shower pressure was pathetic. we were also quoted one particular price but when we arrived at the hotel they wanted to add on an extra 10% for arriving late at night. you can do alot better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DubCM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days recently, the location is good, within easy walking distance to all the major sights, but you walk uphill to get back to it so maybe not the best for older guests. The room was tiny but very clean. Although the hotel is central it is tucked away in a little alley so perhaps a little bit quieter than some others, but Rome is nosy for most of the night. The breakfast is served on the top floor in a nice airy room with good views of Rome but the selection is not that great. But there are lots of nice restaurants close by. While the hotel staff are very helpful and friendly, if you ask them to call a taxi do specify a white taxi otherwise they seem to order their limo service and you will pay more for the airport run.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: egatrop
Reviews.Content: We reserved the hotel at the last minute through the hotel information desk at the Rome airport (FCO). The cobblestone roads and sidewalks made the walk from the central train station to the hotel an interesting welcome to Rome. Its' a pain, but it is do-able. Do not try the walk with non-rolling luggage. The location is great. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from the coliseum, and within easy walk to many other sites like the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, and others. Eating out is not a problem. There are hundreds of sidewalk cafes. The hotel's breakfast is OK. Some cold cuts (meats), some individually wrapped sliced cheese, breads, juice, cereal, danishes. The breakfast room is on an upper floor, is almost all windows, and is nice and bright. I would have like to sit up there and have some wine, but the room is locked up after breakfast. The hotel staff is great; friendly, helpful. The hotel has a bar area in the lobby, but I did not get to spend any time there. Too busy out walking seeing the sites. The room we had was quite cramped for a family of four. I think they had bigger family rooms, but our reservation was made at the last minute. The down-sides: Noise. The streets of Rome are always noisy, except for about 3am to 4am. Our room was hot, so we had to keep the windows open for the cool air. Expensive- The U.S. dollar - Euro exchange rate really hurts. A typical sidewalk cafe meal for four was 40-60 Euro, or about $75. If you can buy a bottle wine rather than by the glass, you'll save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: adrenn
Reviews.Content: A boutique Hotel in the centre of Rome. Clean, well decorated, good staff, lovely position. Spent few days in Rome, we liked the courtesy of the staff and the fantastic room assigned to us. Definitly a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there”
Reviews.Author: manustars
Reviews.Content: I live in Rome and I 've book this Hotel for some friends.... don't do it is not a four stars but a boarding house rooms are old and small with ants everywhere the staff is very unfriendly ,non–existent welcome, no informations and in the morning the manager was too busy for us when we made check out they charged 10% more (without receipt )and he did not accept my credit card ,only cash we needed for a white taxi to the airport at 40,00 euros and he reserved their limo service for 60,00 euros trust to me in that area there are many Hotels less expensive than Bolivar where you may have a good time

Reviews.Title: “A Good Bet”
Reviews.Author: cd98miller
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, situated right in the middle of things. We stayed for five nights. We were within 20 minutes walk of Trevi Foutain, the Spanish Steps, the Colosseum, the Presidential Palace. A short bus ride to the Vatican and St. Peter's. A good breakfast to start the day off right. The hotel is not big, and the rooms are a bit small, but for the money it is a good bet. The staff is very friendly and all too eager to make sure you are off in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Paula32
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Bolivar. Staff were friendly with good english. Room was clean, bright, spacious and very comfortable. The location was excellent and was as close to the main areas as was really walking distance. Highly recommended and we will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL BOLIVAR - A GREAT FIND”
Reviews.Author: jr925cs
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hotel Bolivar every time I come to Rome. It is very clean, with a warm atmosphere. It is centrally located in easy walking distance to the Roman Forum, the Colliseum the Campidoglio and the Trevi fountain. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and informative. All in all, it is a great place too stay, without over spending

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Boilivar, very helpful front office staff and very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelopinion
Reviews.Content: Our family have just returned from a 5 day break in Rome where we stayed at the Hotel Bolivar. This was our 2nd visit there as we booked some rooms there for a family wedding last year. Once again, we found the front office staff very charming and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble and it was lovely to receive a warm greeting as we entered and left the hotel. I see some of the reviews were negative on the location of the hotel as it is placed on a side street but we saw this as an advantage as our room was lovely and quiet and we could even open our window for some fresh air by night. Our room was serviced each day with fresh towels provided and plenty of them to accomodate our children as well. We felt very safe staying in this part of Rome as we had being forewarned about the Termini station area and advised not to stay anywhere near there. We stayed out each night till about 10pm and 11pm and wandered back safely and securely to our hotel. It's very well placed for visiting the Trevi fountain, the Colessium and the main shopping areas. My only suggestion for the hotel would be to improve their breakfast offering as it consisted of two cereals, 3 juices and different breads. Of course we are a little spoilt in Ireland as we offer hotel guests the option of a full irish breakfast or a continental breakfast so that they don't get bored. Of course, the breakfast at the Hotel Bolivar is a good continental breakfast but if you stay for 5 nights as we did, a little more variety would have been nice. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone wanting nice comfortable accomodation in the heart of Rome, ideal for sighseeing.

Reviews.Title: “room? more like a bloody coffin!”
Reviews.Author: tekone
Reviews.Content: Ok, yes this place has a nice location but that was about it. i wouldn’t even visit heaven if i had to stay here again. i actually had to drink soo much that i had passed out to sleep there. the con's - 1) 80's cheesy formica furniture that was warped and wouldnt even close. 2) Bed that felt like we were sleeping on a carving board and a pillow that felt like a rolled up towel in a bag. 3) Walls so thin that every time someone would open or close a door in a room up to 5 rooms away it felt like they were in my room. 4) No lock on the door (combine that with the fact that every time someone opened a door it sounded like they were opening ours) (try sleeping with that feeling.) the pro's - 1) The key to my room made me feel like i won some distinguished medal of honor. 2) The reception/checkin/bellman/doorman/bartender guy (yes you’re reading that right) gave me a break and charged me only 5 euro's for my diet coke instead of 6. 3) I did not plummet to my death in the elevator. (even if it did only one person and a small carryon could die at a time) 4) Our TV had over 25 channels of static. 5) We only could afford to stay one night. Bottom line - I travel allot, i have stayed in more hotels that i can recall and this is definitely the worst room ever. Not to mention at over 300 euro's a complete rip off. Do not trust the pictures; seriously do not trust the pictures. For European students who are in the process of writing there manifesto’s living off some social euro welfare program while going to school this hotel may suffice (even though it is 300+ euro’s a night for the worst room), but if your american this is a clichéd, stereotypical european hotel at it's worse. American travelers be warned.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a room on the 1st floor - reject it and ask for the 2nd or 3rd”
Reviews.Author: DBBDevon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the location and reasonable price. The pictures on the website of the rooms looked quite grand and clean, boasting of Jacuzi bath, internet and satalite TV. On arrival we were allocated our room on the 1st floor. The lock on the door was falling off, the room itself was so small you could not walk around the bed, the wall covering was well past its best with staining as was the carpet. The bathroom was pretty disgusting with a cracked toilet seat , mould in the shower. and no Jacuzi bath . On top of this, when I asked about the interrnet I was told it was wireless connection only and you must have your own laptop ! I spoke to the Receptionist and asked if they had another room and was given the keys for a room on the 2nd floor. Straight away it looked better with a tiled corridor from the lift rather than a grubby carpet and modern doors to the rooms with swipe cards. The room although again very small was quite delightful, a complete contrast with tiled flooring, ornate ceiling frescoes, chandalier and a spotless modern bathroom with shower and Jacuzi bath !! I asked the Receptionist the cost to upgrade and was given the room at no extra cost which was quite a relief. It appears that all rooms on the ground, 2nd and 3rd floor are as described and pictured on the website however those on the 1st floor look like they are awaiting modernisation and would not qualitfy for 1 star. This hotel was great once we received a room that we believed we had booked from the description on the website. It was an ideal location within walking distance of most places. The breakfast was adequate although the tea and coffee were pretty bad. The only real drawback was the lack of internet access. Wireless facilities are great however not everyone want to take a laptop on holiday.
