I would book this hotel again as it was a fair price and in a good area however I would specifiy that I would not want a room on the 1st floor. Basically, if when checking in they pass you a traditional room key ask for another room (these are the grotty rooms). If they give you a swipe card you won't have a problem. Hope this information is of benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ubikchip
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the money we paid. I knew when i booked it wouldnt be 5 star - i was realistic about it all and to be honest, having just come back, i was pleasantly suprised by the standard, hence the 4 out of 5. The hotel was very handily placed for the Colisseum in one direction and Trvei fountain in the other. I had a wife and 2 kids with me and we walked everywhere easily. Front counter staff were always were friendly and helpful, rooms were cleaned thoroughly every day - couldnt ask for more. Breakfast was continental but substantial - scambled or boiled eggs, italian hams, cheeses, croissants, pastries, cereals, orange juice, tea/coffee etc - it was enough for us all. Room was a family room, yes it was tight, but remembering the money i paid, it was adequate - crucially, the shower was good and supplied all the hot water we needed. Please note, i am a fussy person and i would have written if the hotel was crap - it wasnt, it was very good - there was one night when we were disturbed by noise - please note that there is a small pend or alley that goes outside the hotel and our room - we heard 2 gentlemen a bit worse for wear singing in what can only be described as perfect harmony - the four of us sat there and had a great laugh. It was a fab experience, we had a great time - dont let other reviewers put you off - for the money, it was charming and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “will mnever forget it...got engaged!!”
Reviews.Author: pauleeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the begining of December. After the shall i say hair raising taxi drive from the airport, was a bit perturbed because we got dropped off in a back lane!! However, that was where the hotel was based, perhaps for the best because would NOT have liked to have been staying in a hotel on a main street in Rome, traffic is mad!! The hotel looks in need of a bit of decoration to the front, but its not shabby. Contrary to other reviews the staff on reception ( and very soon after the bar) were friendly and efficient. Our rooms were comfortable, slightly musty smelling and a bit dim lit, but nothing I would cry myself to sleep over. Ooh and after an onset of sciatica while we there i needed a bath and we had no plug, but that was sorted within five minutes when we informed the staff. the breakfast room had FAB views, over the rooftops. The breakfast was continental, and buffet style, so you could fill your boots before your day of action. Only thing was the tea was VILE!! they did start serving brekkie dead early though which is good cos you need to start early if youre exploring rome. The hotel was nicely located, in good walking distance for trevi fountain, pantheon, colusseum, spanish steps to name a few. We even managed to walk to the Vatican and st peters square, and it only took about an hour ( and was where we got engaged!!!) All in all i would go here again, no problems at all, nothing but good memories.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: mark2773
Reviews.Content: We travelled up from Sorrento and wanted somewhere to stay for a short trip to Rome. We chose bolivar as it looked good and the reports were mixed. When we arrived it was in a side street, the service at the counter was awful you had to almost hassle them to get noticed, the room we stayed in you literally couldnt swing a cat in. The noise level was brutal- so in conclusion if you value your sanity avoid it as there are far better places at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Service”
Reviews.Author: SJHB
Reviews.Content: We were in Italy in late September. We went to Rome first,so the Bolivar was the first hotel we stayed in. It was clean and the rooms were comfortable. The breakfast room with its views over the rooftops of Rome was very attractive. The location in Rome was excellent for walking to most of the sights. However, the attitude of the desk clerks was somewhat unfriendly and not very helpful. We thought at first that perhaps this was just the Italian way, but everywhere else that we stayed in the course of our trip people were extremely nice and went out of their way to make us comfortable. There were also some maintenance issues at the hotel. Our friends' room had a malfunctioning toilet, which the management tried to fix for two days. Finally, they were moved to another room, but in the process, they had no room for a full day and when they came back mid-day for a break from sightseeing had no room available to them. In our room the air conditioning stopped working the last night we were there. We were surprised that there was no internet available for use in the hotel, and in fact it was the only place we stayed that did not have internet for the guests to use. We also could not get ice because they said their icemaker was broken. I realize that Europeans do not use ice the way Americans do, but once again, this was the only hotel that would not provide it when requested. One further disappointment in the hotel was the coffee which was served with breakfast. It tasted very much like powdered instant coffee. Once again, we were afraid that this was the way coffee was in Italy, but the coffee everywhere else was quite good. We stayed at the Bolivar because it was recommended to our friends. We would have done better to follow our usual procedure and select our hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Switched from originally booked hotel in Ludovici Group”
Reviews.Author: doorrag
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that I have been a frequent visitor to all parts of Italy over the last thirty five years both for business and pleasure. For our recent stay in Rome, we booked accommodation through a reliable Internet accommodation service (Viamichelin in cooperation with Venere): we chose the Ara Pacis both for its reputed standard of service and for its location. When we arrived there to check in, we were informed that this Hotel could not accommodate us and we had been moved to another in the Ludovici Group, namely The Hotel Bolivar. No clear reason for this action was given to us but the staff at The Ara Pacis assured me that The Bolivar was either 4 star or of 4 star standard (Italian was used to advise us of this turn in events and, although mine is not perfect, I am absolutely sure "quattro stelle" was used). We had no choice but to accept. The Bolivar was in a completely different part of Rome which we found most inconvenient; further, it seemed to me that in many of its service standards it was no better that a 2 star Sicilian pensione. We were charged the full amount for our stay before we could inspect the room. The room in no way resembled that used on their web site; some of the bathroom fittings and finishes were a disgrace; some aspects of the breakfast service were very low standard (plastic juice cups and processed cheese in plastic sheeting is neither 4 nor 3 star). Further, the official State documentation in the room we had clearly indicated the Bolivar was THREE stars not 4. I notice that the switcheroo trick has been commented upon in a TripAdvisor review of another hotel in the Ludovici Group in which guests have been moved to the Bolivar from the Hotel Principessa Tea. I will not be using The Ludovici Group's services in future, nor recommending them to colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but nice location”
Reviews.Author: brian796
Reviews.Content: I searched all over for a cheaper place with decent reviews in central Rome, and finally gave up. This hotel, like all decent ones in central Rome, is expensive. However, if you get over that and are willing to spend the money to be central to ancient Rome, consider this location. We had one day in Rome, so chose to stay here to maximize the time available for sight-seeing instead of getting to/from hotel/sites. You are in easy walking distance to Colosseum, Palantine Hill, the Roman Forum, and many Piazza's, etc. There wasn't anywhere that we wanted to go that wasn't within walking distance. The room itself was very small and a little worn, but sufficient for somewhere clean to sleep. The front desk was helpful. The breakfast was free, but minimal (cereal, croissants, etc). Advice for those staying here and needing transport from the airport... take advantage of the hotel's fixed-rate car service. Our metered taxi ride from the airport was more expensive and was very cramped. The hired car was more reasonably priced, higher quality, and lots of room for the entire family.

Reviews.Title: “loved it !!!!! got engaged!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we went to rome and i got proposed to!!! this is truly a memorable place to visit, we stayed for 3 days and saw most things to see.bear in mind-take good walking boots!well worth a visit though be aware-taxi cabs a big big big rip off- dont trust them!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oconnors
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location within walking distance of major sites, approximately 10 minutes to the Trevi fountain, Roman Forum etc. Our room was on the first floor and was definitely in need of remodelling. However, it was clean. The hotel is situated off the busy street, in a courtyard, which makes it quiet. There is a lovely restaurant directly across the courtyard from the hotel. Handy, just in case one is too tired from walking around Rome to venture very far for dinner! Breakfast was the standard continental buffet, on the third floor. I was disappointed that fresh coffee wasn't provided, it was in a boiler. A fresh espresso would have been perfect to start a day of serious walking around Rome! Staff was competent; but we didn't ask for much. This hotels main advantage is its location.

Reviews.Title: “No better location for a hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location! We were within walking distance of all the sights - approx. 10 mins or less from Trevi, Spanish Steps, back streets to Piazza Navonna, colleseum and Termini etc. etc. Staff were really really nice. We had a problem with no hot water but were moved as soon as another room became available. Also there is a great bar at the end of the steps outside if you want a MAD night out. This is only a 3 star hotel so it is not the lap of luxury and be careful of the steps, they are very uneven - we did have one of our party (in high heels) fall! Would definitely stay there again mainly because of the location and we did get our rooms at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: YorbaLinda15
Reviews.Content: Great blocation within walking distance of major sites - this is what you're paying for. Our room on the first floor was definitely in need of remodel; however, the bathroom was newer and very clean. Everything worked. Staff was competent; but we didn't ask for much.

Reviews.Title: “Short on Customer Relations”
Reviews.Author: access232
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay in this hotel as I had to cut my trip in Italy short due to a family matter back home. A request to cancel was made by phone just within 72 hours of arrival explaining the situation. I don't recall a less sympathetic hotel in over 30 years of travel. Needless to say, I swallowed the charge and they were free to re-sell the room.
